text: Abraham Isaac (1828 1906) was a clergyman in the Church of Ireland"A New History of Ireland" Moody,T.W; Martin,F.X; Byrne,F.J;Cosgrove,A: Oxford, OUP, 1976 in the second half of the nineteenth century and the first decade of the twentieth."Handbook of British Chronology" By Fryde, E. B;. Greenway, D.E;Porter, S; Roy, I: Cambridge, CUP, 1996 , 9780521563505 Isaac was educated at Trinity College, Dublin.Alumni Dublinenses : a register of the students, graduates, professors and provosts of Trinity College in the University of Dublin (1593-1860), Burtchaell,G.D/Sadlier,T.U p430: Dublin, Alex Thom and Co, 1935 Rector Valentia 183047, After a curacy at Ardfert he held incumbencies at Kilcolman, Killiney, Valentia and Kilgobbin. He was Dean of Ardfert"The Church of Ireland in County Kerry" Murphy, J.A. p243: Cork, Lulu, 2016 from 1895 until his death on 4 March 1906.‘ISAAC, Very Rev. Abraham’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2016; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 29 April 2017 ==References== Category:Deans of Ardfert Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin Category:1828 births Category:1906 deaths
title: Abraham Isaac
